tool.name: IDFileConverter
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ln -s '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && mkdir out && #if $mz_file: mkdir mz_file && ln -s '$mz_file' 'mz_file/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $mz_file.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($mz_file.ext)' && #end if
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' -out 'out/output.${out_type}' #if $mz_file: -mz_file 'mz_file/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $mz_file.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($mz_file.ext)' #end if
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${out_type}' '$out' #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.label: Input file or directory containing the data to convert
param.help: This may be:. - a single file in OpenMS database format (.oms),. - a single file in a multi-purpose XML format (.idXML, .mzid, .pepXML, .protXML),. - a single file in a search engine-specific format (Mascot: .mascotXML, OMSSA: .omssaXML, X! Tandem: .xml, Percolator: .psms, xQuest: .xquest.xml),. - a single file in fasta format (can only be used to generate a theoretical mzML),. - a single text file (tab separated) with one line for all peptide sequences matching a spectrum (top N hits),. - for Sequest results, a directory containing .out files.. select fasta,idxml,mascotxml,mzid,pepxml,protxml,psms,sqlite,tabular,xquest.xml data sets(s)

param.label: Output file type (default: determined from file extension)
[pepXML, Sequest, Mascot, X
param.help: Tandem, mzid, Percolator only] Retention times and native spectrum ids (spectrum_references) will be looked up in this file select mzdata,mzml,mzxml data sets(s)

param.label: [pepXML only] Experiment filename/path (extension will be removed) to match in the pepXML file ('base_name' attribute)
[pepXML output only] Write output in the format of a PeptideProphet analysis result
param.help: By default a 'raw' pepXML is produced that contains only search engine results

param.label: [Percolator only] Which of the Percolator scores to report as 'the' score for a peptide hit

section.name: fasta_to_mzml
section.title: [FASTA input + MzML output only] Parameters used to adjust simulation of the theoretical spectra

param.name: isotope_model
param.label: Model to use for isotopic peaks ('none' means no isotopic peaks are added, 'coarse' adds isotopic peaks in unit mass distance, 'fine' uses the hyperfine isotopic generator to add accurate isotopic peaks
param.help: Note that adding isotopic peaks is very slow

param.name: max_isotope
param.label: Defines the maximal isotopic peak which is added if 'isotope_model' is 'coarse'

param.name: max_isotope_probability
param.label: Defines the maximal isotopic probability to cover if 'isotope_model' is 'fine'

param.name: add_metainfo
param.label: Adds the type of peaks as metainfo to the peaks, like y8+, [M-H2O+2H]++

param.name: add_losses
param.label: Adds common losses to those ion expect to have them, only water and ammonia loss is considered

param.name: sort_by_position
param.label: Sort output by position

param.name: add_precursor_peaks
param.label: Adds peaks of the unfragmented precursor ion to the spectrum

param.name: add_all_precursor_charges
param.label: Adds precursor peaks with all charges in the given range

param.name: add_abundant_immonium_ions
param.label: Add most abundant immonium ions (for Proline, Cystein, Iso/Leucine, Histidin, Phenylalanin, Tyrosine, Tryptophan)

param.name: add_first_prefix_ion
param.label: If set to true e.g. b1 ions are added

param.name: add_y_ions
param.label: Add peaks of y-ions to the spectrum

param.name: add_b_ions
param.label: Add peaks of b-ions to the spectrum

param.name: add_a_ions
param.label: Add peaks of a-ions to the spectrum

param.name: add_c_ions
param.label: Add peaks of c-ions to the spectrum

param.name: add_x_ions
param.label: Add peaks of x-ions to the spectrum

param.name: add_z_ions
param.label: Add peaks of z-ions to the spectrum

param.name: y_intensity
param.label: Intensity of the y-ions

param.name: b_intensity
param.label: Intensity of the b-ions

param.name: a_intensity
param.label: Intensity of the a-ions

param.name: c_intensity
param.label: Intensity of the c-ions

param.name: x_intensity
param.label: Intensity of the x-ions

param.name: z_intensity
param.label: Intensity of the z-ions

param.name: relative_loss_intensity
param.label: Intensity of loss ions, in relation to the intact ion intensity

param.name: precursor_intensity
param.label: Intensity of the precursor peak

param.name: precursor_H2O_intensity
param.label: Intensity of the H2O loss peak of the precurso

param.name: precursor_NH3_intensity
param.label: Intensity of the NH3 loss peak of the precurso

param.name: enzyme
param.label: Enzym used to digest the fasta proteins

param.name: missed_cleavages
param.label: Number of allowed missed cleavages while digesting the fasta proteins

param.name: min_charge
param.label: Minimum charge

param.name: max_charge
param.label: Maximum charge

param.name: precursor_charge
param.label: Manually set precursor charge
param.help: (default: 0, meaning max_charge + 1 will be used as precursor charge)

param.label: [Sequest only] Workaround to deal with .out files that contain
param.help: e.g. "+1" in references column,. but do not list extra references in subsequent lines (try -debug 3 or 4)

param.label: [Mascot, pepXML, Percolator only] Regular expression used to extract the scan number or retention time
[+mz_file only] Avoid overriding 'spectra_data' in protein identifications if 'mz_file' is given and 'spectrum_reference's are added/updated
param.help: Use only if you are sure it is absolutely the same 'mz_file' as used for identification

param.label: [+mz_file only] Avoid overriding 'spectrum_reference' in peptide identifications if 'mz_file' is given and a 'spectrum_reference' is already present
[+mz_file only] Annotate the identifications with ion matches from spectra in 'mz_file' using the given tolerance (in Da)
param.help: This will take quite some time

param.label: [FASTA output only] Will concatenate the top peptide hits to one peptide sequence, rather than write a new peptide for each hit
[FASTA output only] Controls how many peptide hits will be exported
param.help: A value of 0 or less exports all hits

param.label: Overrides tool-specific checks
Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

param.name: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS
param.label: Optional outputs

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Converts identification engine file formats.
For more information, visit https://openms.de/doxygen/release/3.1.0/html/TOPP_IDFileConverter.html
